body: Hello @imgross, what versions of wxpython are you using? I feel that ensuring you have the right version installed via `pip install -U wxPython==4.0.7.post2` would work.

Hi @jeylau thanks for the reply! 

I am using wxpython version 4.0.4. Is that a problem cause it is too old? 

I will try updating it as you recommended.

Unfortunately this does not solve the problem. I am getting the same error message:

wx._core.wxAssertionError: C++ assertion "Assert failure" failed at ..\..\src\msw\toolbar.cpp(938) in wxToolBar::Realize(): Could not add bitmap to toolbar

please also use 2.2b7; 

but this is 100% a wxPython issue: `wx._core.wxAssertionError: C++ assertion "Assert failure" failed at ....\src\msw\toolbar.cpp(938) in wxToolBar::Realize():` see here: https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/682#issuecomment-627307639
Thanks for your help. I updated the DLC version to 2.2b7 but I am still receiving the same error message. My wxPython version is 4.0.7.post2. So I am prob doing sth else wrong?
What is the version of matplotlib you're using? I'll try to reproduce the error.

I also thought that could be a problem and ran 

pip install --upgrade matplotlib

So I have version 3.3.0 of matplotlib

But I am still ending up with the same error message.

While we look into it, I would encourage you to pass `plotting=False` so you can move forward ðŸ˜ƒ.  You will then be able to analyze your videos and evaluate prediction quality via `deeplabcut.create_video_with_all_detections` ðŸ˜Š.
Okay thank you! Is it possible that I enter that command via the terminal and still do the rest with the project manager GUI? or is that option selectable via the GUI already?
Sure, you should find "Want to plot predictions (as in standard DLC projects)?" in the middle of that GUI page. Set it to False and you are fine!

hey there, so I tried to continue without the plotting that did not work.

I encountered more problems and will post the respective error messages here (maybe some of them are not a problem that will stop me from proceeding)

1. during network evaluation I try to do x-validation and then the following error pops up:
![DLCerror_xval](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36044114/90793074-8f819100-e30b-11ea-99ae-5a5050657cbe.png)

2. when I proceed to editing videos and analyzing them, I can successfully crop them, but if I want to convert the analzed videos into tracklets, I obtain the following error:
![DLCerror_create_tracklets](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36044114/90793243-c788d400-e30b-11ea-91f3-1ead12f815eb.png)

3. also after that I cannot open the refining tracklets GUI, and I receive this error message:
![DLCerror_trackletGUI](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36044114/90793348-eb4c1a00-e30b-11ea-8278-ae31d44d566c.png) 

Do you have an idea of what I might be doing wrong here?

Thanks very much for your support :)
Isa

@imgross, errors 1 and 2 should go away with installing deeplabcut 2.2b7. As for error 3, it is because you must have passed the wrong pickle file (make sure you select the _bx or _sk.pickle, not the _full.pickle).

I already updated DLC to 2.2b7 previously.

And I do not have the _bx or _sk.pickle file, I only have the _full.pickle or the _meta.pickle file.
I ran the convert_detections2tracklets function by clicking on 'Convert to tracklets' in the project manager GUI. And that is when I received error message 2 from my previous comment.

Aw I got it, I am sorry. The inference_cfg.yaml was certainly produced by an anterior version of DLC; a couple of entries have changed since then. An easy fix is to open the inference_cfg in dlc-models/.../test and replace topktoplot by topktoretain, and add upperbound_factor: 1.25 and lowerbound_factor: .5. I think that is all you need, but to confirm you could find the most recent template in the root folder of deeplabcut (next to version.py and pose_cfg.yaml), and check whether there are no other missing entries.

Thanks for those helpful hints, now I can run the refine tracklet GUI and do not get those error messages anymore.

However, there are new problems popping up and I would appreciate your help with this.

1. when I have launched the tracklets GUI once, closed it and want to reopen it for another video I get the following error and the GUI will not open. In this case I have to restart everything.
![DLC_TrackletGUI](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36044114/90953204-b35ae900-e469-11ea-8df0-409ba5176a90.png)

And then regarding the content I see in the tracklets GUI:

2a. In some of my videos I have one mouse alone, in others I have one adult mouse and a couple of pups which I would like to track. In both type of videos I get frames that are nicely labeled and shown in the tracklet GUI as seen below:
![DLC_TrackletGUI1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36044114/90953233-e1d8c400-e469-11ea-9a6f-115ebc71c79c.png)

2b. In other frames of the same video, labels are entirely absent. Am I having some wrong setting here? Because I do see correct labels on the mice in the labeled-videos folder.
![DLC_TrackletGUI2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36044114/90953250-092f9100-e46a-11ea-8d06-dc3818a81930.png)

Do you have an idea of what is going on?
Thanks,
Isa

And sorry I forgot this point:

Also before I run the refinement tracklet GUI, I crop the videos in the video editor section. But the video frames that I then observe in the tracklet GUI do not show me the cropped frames.

There is no way the video could be cropped then show up whole. The video editor tab creates a new separate video which you would need to run through analyze_videos and then convert2tracklets. Be sure you open the correct cropped video file and associated pickle file in the tracklet GUI.
You can decide to fill in every frame or not in the GUI. Please see the demo videos here: https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=YSRQT8N2vFE

In my case the video editor is not creating a new video after I cropped it. The cropping GUI pops up, I draw the rectangle, but how can I then save this or apply this to the video?

And regarding the tracklet GUI: 
What can I do about it giving me the error as described in my previous comment (error no.1) when I want to relaunch the tracklet GUI as you describe in your tutorial to test out certain parameters, as for example the min swap fraction?

And do you have an idea of why certain frames in the tracklet GUI do not contain any labels? And weirdly in the .mp4 video that was created before through analyze videos, there are not any frames detectable that have missing labels. Why could there be a mismatch between that 'pre-tracked' video and the tracklets from the GUI?
